image.altText: QPS ConstablesÂ Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold

props.synopsis: An inquest has heard Constable Rachel McCrow recorded a message for her family before she was murdered in the ambush in December 2022.

title.children: Officer's final act before being gunned down in Wieambilla shootings

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Blue Room

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese challenges the opposition leader to sack Barnaby Joyce for telling protesters to "load that magazine" and "say goodbye" to the prime minister and other senior Labor figures.

title.children: PM calls for Barnaby Joyce to be sacked for telling voters to use votes as 'bullets'

image.altText: A woman in a suit with short white hair walks forward, flanked by two men in suits.

props.synopsis: Beijing pressures politicians not to attend a China-focused summit in Taiwan as Australian, US, Japanese, and Indian foreign leaders discuss countering Chinese aggression at the Quad meeting in Tokyo.

title.children: Wong announces new cable connectivity centre as Quad meets in Japan

image.altText: A smiling young woman closes her eyes and smells a sunflower in a field.

props.synopsis: Jennifer Board was fatally struck by a vehicle driven by a vigilante driver in 2021. The manslaughter trial of the other driver involved in the chase is underway in Townsville.

title.children: High-speed 'game' with vigilante played out ahead of crash that killed 22-year-old motorcyclist, court hears

image.altText: A court sketch of a man sitting next to a lawyer.

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court in Toowoomba has been played recordings of conversations between Tane Desatge and undercover police who were investigating the disappearance of two-year-old Kaydence Mills.

title.children: Murder accused confessed to undercover police to burying toddler's body, court hears

image.altText: Lauren Jackson holds a basketball above her head

props.synopsis: Australia's women's basketball team takes on Nigeria in the first Group B match, while the swimming program continues, the Kookaburras take to the field, and one of tennis's greatest rivalries comes to a close. Follow live.

title.children: Opals kick off their Olympic campaign, Djokovic and Nadal face off at Roland Garros

image.altText: Two women and a man wearing uniform t-shirts stand with their arms around each other, smiling.

props.synopsis: A Queensland charity has overcome a major setback after its trailer was stolen along with thousands of dollars' worth of clothing and sleeping bags, just hours before they were due to be donated to homeless people.

title.children: Volunteers rescue charity's event after thieves steal trailer with $10k in donations

image.altText: Four female Australian swimmers smile and embrace at poolside after winning an Olympic gold medal.

props.synopsis: Commentator Bob Ballard attracts criticism after likening Australia's gold-medal-winning swimmers to women "doing their makeup".

title.children: Olympics commentator removed over 'outrageous' comment on Australian swim team

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus looks at Mollie O'Callaghan as she rolls over a lane rope

props.synopsis: The 200m is the happy medium that brings two of Australia's greatest swimming stars together, the crucible that can and will develop enough heat and pressure to make diamonds of them both.

title.children: In Titmus vs O'Callaghan, Australia is set to see one of the great sporting rivalries play out on the biggest stage

image.altText: Kamala Harris, in a beige suite, looks over her shoulders at the top of aircraft stairs

props.synopsis: In the extraordinary moment when Donald Trump was left bloodied by a would-be assassin's bullet, the political reality changed. Then, it was the Democrats' turn for a dramatic twist.

title.children: Trump seemed indestructible, but a remarkable new dynamic has emerged in the race for the White House

image.altText: A crowd of men carries a coffin and a portrait of a girl

props.synopsis: As Israel convenes its security cabinet following a rocket strike in Golan Heights, US Vice-President Kamala Harris says her support for Israel's security remains "ironclad".

title.children: US blames Hezbollah for Golan Heights strike

image.altText: Commonwealth Bank signage outside Brisbane branch

props.synopsis: Commonwealth Bank has been issued with two fines worth $18,000 each after pleading guilty to not paying long service entitlements to staff.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank fined $36k after pleading guilty to not paying long service entitlements to staff

image.altText: Frozen written onto a frozen car

props.synopsis: Queenslanders wake up to frost covering their windscreens and lawns as a cold snap hits the state.

title.children: Frozen windscreens and icy grass as Queensland hit with wintry blast

image.altText: A drill rig in a field.

props.synopsis: The Queensland farming group that challenged the federal government in court says all parties, including mining giant Glencore, have agreed to terms to end the legal proceedings.

title.children: Agreement reached in court case over plan to inject waste into Great Artesian Basin

image.altText: A boy writes with a pencil in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Dealing with poor behaviour and reporting incidents is the most common workload burden affecting teachers' ability to help their students learn, according to a new survey of Queensland state schools.

title.children: Managing student behaviour is piling pressure on teachers, survey finds

image.altText: Sakina Muhammad Jan, wearing a black headdress and surgical mask, walks with a man outside court.

props.synopsis: A woman has collapsed in court after a Shepparton mother was jailed for at least a year for forcing her daughter to marry a man who murdered her six weeks later.

title.children: Mother who 'abused' power to force daughter into deadly marriage jailed by Victorian court

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese moves ahead with his Future Made in Australia plan, key stakeholders raise questions about how the scheme will be managed and what rules will apply.

title.children: Should gas giants get subsidies under the PM's signature clean energy scheme?

image.altText: Former TV host Andrew OâKeefe leaves Waverley Police Station after being granted bail Monday, July 29, 2024

props.synopsis: Former TV game show host Andrew O'Keefe is released on bail after spending Sunday night in police custody charged with violating an Apprehended Domestic Violence Order.

title.children: Former TV host released from custody after allegedly breaching domestic violence order

image.altText: The entrance of an underground train station with city buildings in the background. Signposts with the letter 'M' nearby.

props.synopsis: The highly anticipated Chatswood to Sydenham route runs under Sydney Harbour, directly linking north-west commuters to the CBD, and is scheduled to open this Sunday.

title.children: Sydney Metro yet to be ticked off by safety regulator days out from scheduled opening

image.altText: Copy of Copy of Copy of AFLart

props.synopsis: Simone Biles puts in a stunning performance despite an injury, Andy Murray's career lasts another day, and a random bloke in his togs gets the crowd going at the pool â here's the quick hits from day two.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Biles hurt but still stars, heartache in the judo, and bloke in his togs steals the show at the pool

image.altText: An aerial image of a housing estate with rows of homes with white and grey rooves that have a consistent look.

props.synopsis: The $12 billion land lease industry, which caters to retirees looking for affordable low-maintenance living, has largely flown under the radar. But across the country, more claims are emerging of questionable practices including fee gouging, excessive rent increases and misleading contracts.

title.children: 'Do your homework': Retirees turn on each other over gated villages

image.altText: A young man standing in an airport holding his luggage

props.synopsis: With his bag checked in and passport in hand, Michael Pascale boarded an international flight in May 2020, oblivious to the real journey he was embarking on.

title.children: 'I refused to let them win': After this traveller's luggage went missing, he took on the airline â and won

image.altText: Kidney donor mum-daughter duo help dialysis patients

props.synopsis: For Jenny Scott, the decision to become an organ donor was about giving precious years to her daughter with end-stage kidney disease.

title.children: 'I had to save her life': Mum shares the gift that more Australians can give

image.altText: WA Premier Roger Cook looks serious as he speaks at a press conference in front of two flags.

props.synopsis: The WA government will introduce a "fit and proper person" test for union representatives seeking access to worksites, but won't hand back the donations it receives from the CFMEU.Â

title.children: Roger Cook enforcing character tests for union reps as CFMEU says its WA 'record is clean'

image.altText: Young man with long curly hair wearing a black cap, sitting on a couch holding a newborn baby.

props.synopsis: Ned Gronow, 17, was fatally attacked while he slept in his parents' NSW home in 2022. As his killer, Rayne Aylward, awaits his sentence, Ned's parents have told the Supreme Court of the pain of their loss.

title.children: Mother of teen stabbed in his bed tells court she 'cannot unsee the horror' of murder scene

image.altText: Albanese purses his lips as he speaks at a podium

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has made larger-than-expected changes to his frontbench. But a new study shows exactly the depth of trouble his government is in.

title.children: Albanese's woes go much deeper than a reshuffle. Voter confidence has plummeted

image.altText: Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic shake hands

props.synopsis: Is this the last time we'll see Rafael Nadal with racket in hand on the clay surface he's dominated for decades? Only he knows, but a match against one of the greatest of all time â the pair's 60th meeting â has tennis fans salivating.

title.children: Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic to continue titanic rivalry in Olympic clay clash in Paris

image.altText: A smiling man with a brown horse in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: After securing a record-setting 54 wins out of 159 starts, outback racehorse Fab's Cowboy will see out his retirement alongside Melbourne Cup winners, leaving big hole in the lives of his trainers and owners.

title.children: Champion's farewell for beloved horse known as 'bush Phar Lap'

image.altText: A woman named Kylena Hill holds one of her children.

props.synopsis: Kylena Hill says she and her five children are soon to be homeless, while her violent ex-partner is out on bail for multiple, brutal attacks on her.

title.children: A Perth woman's family is facing eviction. Her neighbours say they're a nuisance, but she has nowhere to turn

image.altText: Jess Fox smiles while walking through the crowd with an Australian flag draped over her shoulders

props.synopsis: Jess Fox was already an Olympic gold medallist, and already an Australian sporting champion. But this Paris triumph, celebrated with friends and family and a roaring crowd of Australians, is on a whole other level to anything that came before.

title.children: Jess Fox finally gets the gold medal moment she deserved, surrounded by green, gold and love

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 closed up 0.9 per cent after Wall Street rebounded on Friday from recent weakness. Look back at how the day unfolded on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX 200 closes up 0.9 per cent as focus switches to inflation data, Rex Airlines in trading halt â as it happened

image.altText: A Collingwood AFL player pumps his fists in the grand final against the Brisbane Lions.

props.synopsis: It seems not even time itself can stop former Collingwood skipper Scott Pendlebury, who's committed to another season with the Magpies as he races towards the 400 game milestone this weekend.

title.children: Collingwood great confirms new contract ahead of milestone match against Carlton
